alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 3:53PM CDT until June 25 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central St. Clair County in central Alabama... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 353 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Bald Rock, or near Moody, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Pell City, Moody, Riverside, Ragland, Bald Rock, Harrisburg, Branchville, Logan Martin Lake, St. Clair County Airport, Wattsville, Chula Vista, Camp Winnataska and Cropwell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
